Column Comment.0: FIELD STATION ID: unique identifier for the stratigraphic field station.
Column Comment.1: NODE IDENTIFIER: Unique identification number assigned to a specific point (node)on the wellbore.
Column Comment.2: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: COORD ACQUISITION: identifies an assembly of coordinate data that must begrouped together. It should be acquired together at the same time, from the samesource, using the same method and at the same accuracy. May be used to indicatethe level of accuracy of a set of coordinates.
Column Comment.5: COORDINATE SYSTEM ID: unique identifier for the coordinate system.
Column Comment.6: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.7: ELEVATION: the elevation of the field station node.
Column Comment.8: ELEVATION ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: The units of measure that theelelvation was originally obtained in (such as feet or meters).
Column Comment.9: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.10: LATITUDE: The "selected" latitude for this node relative to the Equator.
Column Comment.11: LOCAL COORDINATE SYSTEM IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the localcoordinate system, such as a local grid system (ATS, STS, MTS etc) to which thesecoordinates have been referenced. Coordinates that are referenced to a localcoordinate system are usually surveyed relative to the local system using metes andbounds or local survey references; maintaining the position of each point relative toits referenced local system is very important to survey accuracy.
Column Comment.12: LONGITUDE: The "selected" longitude for this node relative to the prime meridian ofthe Geodetic Datum.
Column Comment.13: STRATIGRAPHIC FIELD STATION NODE LOCATION TYPE: the type of location fora field station node. Locations may exist across the surface of a field station orvertically, to describe depths. Types may include sample point, corner, hole surface,hole bottom etc.
Column Comment.14: ORIGINAL OBSERVATION NUMBER: The observation number of the originalversion of the node coordinates. Used when the Original coordinate units are not lat,long. With the Node ID, this identifies the row containing the original values
Column Comment.15: ORIGINAL XY UNITS OF MEASURE: The units of measure for the original version ofthe node coordinates.
Column Comment.16: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.17: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.18: SELECTED OBSERVATION: The observation number of the selected version of thenode latitude, longitude. Together with the Node ID this uniquely identifies the row inWell Node Version where the Node Latitude, Longitude are selected from.
Column Comment.19: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.20: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.21: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.22: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.23: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.24: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.25: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
